lead_paragraph: Novartis, the large Swiss drug maker, said Monday that it would take control of the eye care company Alcon by buying a majority stake from Nestlé for $28.1 billion. The move would raise its stake in Alcon to 77 percent, and Novartis said it was interested in acquiring the rest of the shares.

headline.main: Novartis to Pay $28 Billion for a Majority Stake in Alcon
headline.print_headline: Novartis to Pay $28 Billion for a Majority Stake in Alcon and Wants to Buy the Rest

abstract: An independent committee of directors of Alcon is disappointed with a takeover bid from Novartis, saying the Swiss drug maker is trying to circumvent protections for minority shareholders.
